sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Writes random bytes to caller-provided destination; if pointer references shared memory, this outputs data to Normal World or may overwrite unintended memory

sinks.name: TEE_GenerateRandom
sinks.reason: Size controls how many bytes are written; tainted or unvalidated length can cause buffer overflow or out-of-bounds write

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Tainted size can cause incorrect allocation size leading to buffer overflows or memory corruption in subsequent operations, or denial of service due to excessive allocation
